contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox building |image=Rosenbad 2006.jpg |caption=Rosenbad |name=Rosenbad |location_town=[[Stockholm]] |location_country=[[Sweden]] |architect=[[Ferdinand Boberg]] |client= |engineer= |construction_start_date=1900 |completion_date=1902 |date_demolished= |cost= |structural_system= |style= }} '''Rosenbad''' ''(Rose bath)'' is a building in central [[Stockholm]], precinct of ''[[Norrmalm]]'', designed by [[Art Nouveau]] architect [[Ferdinand Boberg]] and completed in 1902. Rosenbad is located on ''Strömgatan'' on the North side of the river [[Norrström]]. Originally housing a variety of functions, including a restaurant (until 1956) of the same name, it now functions as the '''Prime Minister's Office''' and the '''[[Government of Sweden|Government]] Chancellery''' in [[Sweden]]. It is located close to the [[Sager Palace|Sager House]], the official residence of the [[Prime Minister of Sweden|Prime Minister]] and across the water of [[Stockholms ström]] from the [[Parliament House, Stockholm|Parliament House]] and the [[Stockholm Palace|Royal Palace]]. ==See also== *[[Politics of Sweden]]'' ==External links== {{commons category|Rosenbad}} *[http://www.sweden.gov.se/sb/d/4142 The Rosenbad building], official website *[http://www.arti-fact.com/architect/country/1772 Rosenbad building street view] {{Government ministries of Sweden}} {{coord|59|19|42|N|18|03|56|E|region:SE_type:landmark|display=title}} [[Category:Buildings and structures in Stockholm]] [[Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1902]]
